text: Mayfield is a locality in the Queanbeyan–Palerang Regional Council, New South Wales, Australia. It is located about 85 km east of Canberra and 58 km south of Goulburn. At the , it had a population of 22. It had an Anglican church, St Luke's from 1895 to 1965. A "half-time" school was located at Virginia station in Mayfield from 1894 to 1899. ==Heritage listings== Mayfield has a number of heritage-listed sites, including: * Charleyong Road: Virginia ==References== Category:Localities in New South Wales Category:Queanbeyan–Palerang Regional Council Category:Southern Tablelands
title: Mayfield (Queanbeyan–Palerang)
